comments.comment: in my opinion there is big loop hole to the internal security of Sri Lanka due to the fact that we do not have a proper account of people who have come on a visit visa but over stayed in Sri¬† Lanka and whereabout they stay. I personally asked this question from a senior immigration officer at Katunayake Airport but without getting a robust answer from him. very soon they will obtain the Sri Lankan passport . it is so easy to get Gramsewaka letter from the areas where some communities are living. eventually they will be Sri Lankan passport holders who cannot speak Tamil, Sinhala or even English. Even I experienced a housemaid who doesn't know what is Kiribath? but holding Sri Lankan passport and she cannot speak Tamil or Sinhalese.

replies.replyComment: Ammata huka gan nethuwa hitapa pakaya thope ratak name meka ape lankawa thopi palayau arabiyata huka gan nethuwa
Mama ne kiwe ara amaya kiyana baluchchita
Ane gon urooo thopita dahamak na ekai ohoma penne
kauda ban me balu Kary walin ipadila tiyana huththi
Mole  hoda mafu wageee. Cheq jara gaththoth hodai ikmantaaa
Uba ganiyak da pirimiyakda  natm napusakada amma paduru ase ringala hadagate ubala wage un me mahapolawata barakk

This is how mahinda supporters talk to a girl, a fellow Sinhalese citizen. Just like everyone else, she also has the right to express her opinion. All the other nationalities are looking out for each other. Yet Sinhalese people are divided for the sake of a politician. If we go on like this, Sinhalese people will not make up the majority of people in Sri Lanka anymore. Fate is brought on us by our own people. We cannot blame other people for it! It is very ugly the way women address another woman. Karma will prevail..
Ane pala huthti ai ubata pukey amaruda
Ditta damma wedaneeya padisan denawamai.bududahama  anuwa.budda  chiwarayata  garu karapiya.
pissu thotai belliye thoge agama mokakda rata wenuwen kathakaralai un wahanse hire wetune
